method.text: Pound and grind the nuts and garlic in a mortar and pestle, until pulverised
Rinse the basil, chop, add to the mortar with a little salt, and grind again until well broken down
Add cheese and oil, grind a third time until it froms a smooth green paste
Carefully test and adjust the salt as necessary

notes.text: The amount of garlic varies wildly depending on how strong it is. So start with half a clove if you're not sure
Cheese - to be correct, this should really be a mix of parmesan/fiore sardo or parmesan/pecorino
Nuts - this uses cedar nuts instead of pine nuts, since they're way cheaper and i can't tell the difference
Some recipes suggest adding a small amount of butter. This probably gives a creamier result when you mix it with pasta and cooking water, as per the serving suggestion
Can also be done in a food processor, but won't be quite as good

serving_suggestions.text: Mix with your choice of pasta and a few spoons of the pasta cooking water
